description: Difference between the largest prime < 10^n (A003618) and 10^n.
references: Knuth, Art of Computer Programming, volume 2, pages 13 and 390.
Journal of Recreational Mathematics, volume 14, number 4 ,page 285.
Journal of Recreational Mathematics, volume 20 ,number 3, page 209-210.
O'Hara, J. Rec. Math., 22 (1990), Table on page 278.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000 (yielding probable primes)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Previous Prime
mathematica: PrevPrime[ n_Integer ] := Module[ {k}, k = n - 1; While[ ! PrimeQ[ k ], k-- ]; k ]; Table[ 10^n - PrevPrime[ 10^n ], {n, 1, 75} ] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 09 2000 *)Table[10^i - NextPrime[10^i, -1], {i, 0, 70}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 13 2011 *)
author: Vasiliy Danilov (danilovv(AT)usa.net)
